intro: Vandellia viscosa, commonly known as the sticky vandellia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Vandellia viscosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
